content:
In that case, I'd recommend considering diffusers in the mid-to-high price range, as they often offer better quality, features, and performance. Here are some general price ranges to expect:

**Basic diffusers**: $10-$30
	* Simple, compact designs
	* Limited features (e.g., single mist mode, small tank capacity)
	* May not be as durable or effective

**Mid-range diffusers**: $30-$60
	* More features (e.g., multiple mist modes, larger tank capacity, timer)
	* Better build quality and durability
	* Good for small to medium-sized rooms

**High-end diffusers**: $60-$100
	* Advanced features (e.g., adjustable mist output, built-in humidistat, remote control)
	* Larger tank capacity and coverage area
	* High-quality materials and durable construction
	* Suitable for larger rooms or for those who want premium performance

**Premium diffusers**: $100-$200
	* Top-of-the-line features (e.g., advanced misting technology, Wi-Fi connectivity, smartphone app control)
	* Large tank capacity and coverage area
	* High-end materials and exceptional build quality
	* Ideal for those who want the best performance and features

Based on your interests in a good-quality diffuser that will last, I'd recommend exploring the mid-range to high-end options ($30-$100). This price range offers a good balance of features, quality, and performance.

Some popular diffusers in this price range include:

* InnoGear Essential Oil Diffuser (around $40)
* URPOWER Essential Oil Diffuser (around $50)
* VicTsing Essential Oil Diffuser (around $60)
* doTERRA Petal Diffuser (around $80)

These diffusers offer a range of features, such as multiple mist modes, timers, and adjustable output, and are known for their good quality and performance.

Do you have any specific preferences or features in mind that might influence your decision?
